Package com.sync.db

Class SyncedMap<T>

java.lang.Object
com.sync.db.SyncedMap<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
Syncable, Serializable
public class SyncedMap<T> extends Object implements Syncable
a wrapper of Map which makes it syncable.

  • Constructor Details

    • SyncedMap

      public SyncedMap(Map<String,T> defaultMap)
      Creates a new list with default items.
      Parameters:
      defaultMap - The default map to use when it doesn't exist in the database.null for empty map.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(SyncedMap.SyncableMapManager<T> manager)
      Updates the map from the interface definition. Just modify the Map object of update(Map) method and it will also be modified in the database immediately and asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      manager - The interface defining the map. Any modification made to that map (which is in the update method) will be considered.

    • get

      public Map<String,T> get()
      Returns a syncable mutable Map. Any modification made to this object will be considered but not be automatically saved to the database. You have to explicitly call SyncDB.commit().
      Returns:
      A syncable mutable map.

    • getItem

      public T getItem(String key)
      Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key whose associated value is to be returned
      Returns:
      the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the key is of an inappropriate type for this map (optional)
      NullPointerException - if the specified key is null and this map does not permit null keys (optional)

    • delete

      public void delete()
      Removes this map from the database. After calling this, it will be no-more syncing with the database until it is updated or modified. This will only be removed when SyncDB.commit() is called.
